intro: Hedyotis novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea geranium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a low herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in clusters along the stems. Hedyotis novoguineensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or stream banks.
